formulaInstructions: To calculate the TG:HDL ratio, divide your triglyceride level by the HDL level. Both triglyceride and HDL levels must be mg/dL unit. If they are in any other unit, convert them first to mg/dL and then calculate the ratio.

source.name: Peter Attia
source.description: I watch the ratio of triglycerides to HDL cholesterol (it should be less than 2:1 or better yet, less than 1:1)

source.name: Robert Lustig
source.description: Values above 1.5 are strongly associated with nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD)
